issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Saw this in CI couple of times already. This system has Equallogic packages installed, but while trying to set the blockstorage backend, it can find equallogic as a valid value,

{noformat}
# eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` &&  //usr/bin/euctl one.storage.blockstoragemanager=equallogic
euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): Cannot modify one.storage.blockstoragemanager.blockstoragemanager new value is not a valid value.  Legal values are: overlay,das,ceph-rbd
{noformat}

But in the cloud-output.log it appears as a legal value:
{noformat}
2016-06-14 11:01:10  INFO | Firing LOAD for local config: one-sc-1
2016-06-14 11:01:10 ERROR | CHECK:null  arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:storage:one-sc-1/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [SC blockstoragemanager not configured. Found empty or unset manager(n
ull).  Legal values are: overlay,das,ceph-rbd,equallogic]
2016-06-14 11:01:11  INFO | Firing LOAD for local config: one-sc-1
2016-06-14 11:01:11 ERROR | START:DISABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:storage:one-sc-1/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [SC blockstoragemanager not configured. Found empty or unset manag
er(null).  Legal values are: overlay,das,ceph-rbd,equallogic]
{noformat}

Eucalyptus Equallogic san packages:
{noformat}
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.3.0
Release     : 0.6320.313.20160610git81b8fe2.el7
Size        : 26 k
Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus-enterprise-release
Summary     : Eucalyptus EqualLogic SAN adapter
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License     : Eucalyptus SLA
Description : Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
            : using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
            : with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
            : computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
            :
            : This package contains the SAN adapter for Dell EqualLogic SAN devices.

Name        : eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic-libs
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.3.0
Release     : 0.6320.313.20160610git81b8fe2.el7
Size        : 25 k
Repo        : installed
From repo   : eucalyptus-enterprise-release
Summary     : Eucalyptus Equallogic SAN adapter libraries
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
License     : Eucalyptus SLA
Description : Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
            : using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
            : with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
            : computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
            :
            : This package contains libraries necessary to configure and run a
            : storage controller that is capable of managing a Dell Equallogic SAN
            : device.  This package must be installed on a cloud controller in
            : order for it to be capable of configuring storage controllers with
            : SAN support.
{noformat}

*euserve-describe-services*
{noformat}
# euserv-describe-services
SERVICE  autoscaling           API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.autoscaling     enabled
SERVICE  autoscalingbackend    eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  bootstrap             bootstrap         10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  cloudformation        API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.cloudformation  enabled
SERVICE  cloudwatch            API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.cloudwatch      enabled
SERVICE  cloudwatchbackend     eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  cluster               one               one-cc-1                         enabled
SERVICE  compute               API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.compute         enabled
SERVICE  dns                   API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.dns             enabled
SERVICE  euare                 API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.euare           enabled
SERVICE  eucalyptus            eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  identity              API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.identity        enabled
SERVICE  imaging               API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.imaging         enabled
SERVICE  imagingbackend        eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     notready
SERVICE  loadbalancing         API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.loadbalancing   enabled
SERVICE  loadbalancingbackend  eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     notready
SERVICE  notifications         eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  objectstorage         API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.objectstorage   enabled
SERVICE  pollednotifications   eucalyptus        10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  reporting             bootstrap         10.111.1.211                     enabled
SERVICE  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.simpleworkflow  enabled
SERVICE  storage               one               one-sc-1                         broken
SERVICE  tokens                API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207.tokens          enabled
SERVICE  user-api              API_10.111.1.207  API_10.111.1.207                 enabled
SERVICE  walrusbackend         walrus            walrus-1                         enabled
{noformat}
fields.summary: 'equallogic' doesn't show as a valid value when san-equallogic packages are installed

comments.body: I have a system in this state, I haven't restarted any services. Please let me know if you need access to the machines.

[~sjones], looks like the requests are being sent to http://127.0.0.1:8773/services/Properties {noformat} # eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` && //usr/bin/euctl seeing the same issue after restarting eucalyptus-cloud again on CLC.
Thanks [~sjones], I am closing this one. I will reopen EUCA-12440 if I continue to see this issue.
